name.value: FHIR Connectathon 14 - Patient - Formal Testing - FHIR Client - Delete - XML

description.value: Patient Track - Formal Testing - tests external FHIR Client and Server to delete Patient with the optional response content in XML format. The origin and destination systems must support the delete operation. The destination system must also support the read operation to verify the deletion.
Enter the patient FHIR resource id the origin system will send to the destination system.

Test the delete operation of a known valid resource instance. The expected response is 200 (OK) when XML content is returned; e.g. OperationOutcome, or 204 (No Content) when the content is empty. A subsequent read operation is executed to confirm the deleted resource is not returned.
Patient delete operation of a known valid resource instance.
Confirm that the client requested an Accept of the FHIR XML mime type 'application/fhir+xml'. Warning only as the client may not send this by default.
Confirm that the client did not request a Content-Type. Warning only as the client may send this by default.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 200(OK) or 204(No Content).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type is not present. Warning only as the server may set this header by default.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header ETag is present. Warning only as the server may not support versioning.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Last-Modified is not present. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Location is not present. Warning only to allow subsequent asserts to execute.

Read the deleted Patient and verify the response is 410 (Gone) or 404 (Not Found) for servers that do not support versioning. The Accept header XML format is defined for an optionally returned OperationOutcome resource.
Confirm that the returned HTTP status is 404(Not Found) or 410(Gone).
Confirm that the returned HTTP Header Content-Type contains the FHIR mime-type 'application/fhir+xml'. Warning only as a response content is optional but servers are encouraged to return this.
Confirm that the returned resource type is OperationOutcome. Warning only as this is optional but servers are encouraged to return an OperationOutcome for any additional information.
